sentence.idiomatic: I haggled with him forever, but the shop owner still wasn't willing to lower the price.
OK, OK, I'll buy it for you. I can't take you pestering me like this.
Stop pestering. You can talk until you're blue in the face and he still won't hear what you're saying.
My house is near the train station. Every night I go to sleep to the roar of the trains.
You have to speak loudly in order to be heard over the roar of the construction machinery.
There must be something wrong with this car, the engine is roaring so loud.
It's too noisy out here, let's go inside to talk.
Turn down the stereo, it's too noisy.
Three women talking and laughing at the same time is a real racket.
The things packed in here are all fragile, don't knock them around.
Every automobile must go through collision testing before it enters the market.
Everyone must interact and clash a little in order to perfect their ideas.
After participating in these Olympics, he will be retiring.
I've used this car for over ten years. It should be taken off the road.
I became a soldier when I was 18, and retired from duty when I was 20.
In China, you can bargain the price down on almost anything you want to buy.
I can't bargain for things. Every time I buy something I pay too much.
He is great at bargaining. He can get something that costs 100RMB for 20RMB.
Dear, it's finally settled!
What's settled?
Look, two tickets to the Formula One 2007 season race. I had to haggle with that scalper forever.
Oh, didn't I already tell you that I didn't want to go? If you want to go, go alone.
Hey now, you know I'm an insane racing fan. I'd say the roar of the engines is the sweetest sound on earth.

word.literal: to be unable to see clearly

sentence.idiomatic: It's such a racket. I really don't get what's so great about F1. I really regretted going to watch last year. We sat so far from the racetrack that when the cars whooshed past we couldn't even see anything clearly.
What you go for is the atmosphere. We saw the tire marks, the suspenseful feeling of the high speed turns, the cars colliding into each other, the...
Quit your rambling. Didn't you already see all that yesterday afternoon?

Please, yesterday was the qualifying race. This afternoon is the final race. Yesterday Hamilton got the pole position from McLaren. But my gut feeling is that it's Raikkonen with Ferrari that's going to win the championship.
Oh. What about Schumacher?
Oh, he's already retired. The way I see it, this season's final champion is going to be either Hamilton or Raikkonen.
I don't know what to do with you. Practice races, preliminary races, final races... you don't miss a single one.
How about this--if you'll go with me, I'll take you out to dinner tonight.
Plus some after dinner shopping activities?
Uhhh... OK! Heh heh, you're even better than the scalpers at cutting a deal.

word.literal: to bargain for a lower price
